did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: University of Arizona Office of the President records, 1914-1937
did.abstract: The University of Arizona Office of the President records consist of correspondence and financial papers relating to administration and management of areas such as building and grounds, faculty and student issues, military and R.O.T.C., land acquisitions, academic departments, requests for information, Federal relief programs of 1932-1937, external agencies and organizations, and other issues.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: University of Arizona. Office of the President

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: University of Arizona Office of the President records(AZ 420). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into five series:

list.item: Series I. R.B. von KleinSmid and Frank C. Lockwood Papers, 1914-1922
Series II. Cloyd H. Marvin Papers, 1922-1927
Series IV. Homer L. Shantz Papers, 1928-1936
Series V. Paul S. Burgess Papers, 1936-1937

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and financial papers relating to administration and management of areas such as building and grounds, faculty and student issues, military and R.O.T.C., land acquisitions, academic departments, requests for information, Federal relief programs of 1932-1937, external agencies and organizations, and other issues. Correspondents include Governors George W.P. Hunt, John C. Phillips, and Benjamin B. Moeur; various Board of Regents members, U.S. Veteran's Bureau, Arizona Historical Society, Arizona State Legislature, University faculty members, and others. Includes professional activity files of Homer L. Shantz.

item.persname: Hunt, George W. P. (George Wylie Paul), 1859-1934 -- Correspondence

item.corpname: University of Arizona -- Records and correspondence

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional President's papers at AZ 76, AZ 406, AZ 426, AZ 427.

did.unittitle: Series I: R.B. von KleinSmid and Cloyd H. Lockwood Papers, 1914-1922
R.B. von KleinSmid miscellaneous correspondence, includes the Proposed Plan of Administration for the University of Arizona, as adopted by the Faculty, October 1, 1920. 1916-1921
R.B. von KleinSmid miscellaneous correspondence, includes the Proposed Plan of Administration for the University of Arizona, as adopted by the Faculty, October 1, 1920. 1916-1921
R.B. von KleinSmid miscellaneous financial papers, most refer to Agricultural Extension work. 1916-1921
R.B. von KleinSmid materials regarding Students Army Training Corps, includes material on the local flu epidemic, and the use of University facilities. 1917-1919
R.B. von KleinSmid materials regarding subscriptions from mining companies for the Mines and Engineering Building. 1916-1918
R.B. von KleinSmid materials regarding the establishment of Post Office in "Old Main". 1920-1921
R.B. von KleinSmid materials regarding the Federal Board for Vocational Education. 1920-1921
R.B. von KleinSmid materials regarding the Yuma Experiment Station fence controversy. 1920-1921
R.B. von KleinSmid, Brochures for Forest Laun Memorial Park, 1952-1954
Frank C. Lockwood correspondence with former President von KleinSmid. 1921-1922
Frank C. Lockwood miscellaneous financial papers. 1922
Frank C. Lockwood materials regarding buildings and grounds, includes fire escapes and street improvements. 1922
Frank C. Lockwood materials regarding poultry projects. 1922
Frank C. Lockwood materials regarding Veterans' Bureau. 1922
Frank C. Lockwood statistical material for the U.S. Bureau of Education Survey Committee, published as Report of a Survey of the University of Arizona. 1922
Series II: Cloyd H. Marvin Papers, 1922-1927
Requests for Information: Salaries, Marble Quarries in Arizona.
President Marvin's reorganization of faculty. October 1922
Faculty: Dean of Women, forms used.
Department of Health Administration: Includes infirmary reports, fees and financial records, lists of consulting physicians, etc. 1923-1926
Department of Law Reports and Syllabi. 1924

scopecontent.p: Includes material regarding the paving of Second Street, faculty salary scales, literary lecture series, dining hall report, Experiment Station work, improvements on University grounds, and a Taxpayer Committee's complaint about the University's expenditures.

did.unittitle: Land sale of the Experiment Station Farm, Cochise County. 1925-1926
Association of Governing Boards of State Universities and Allied Institutions. 1923-1925

scopecontent.p: Material includes more on the Plan of Administration of the University; Doctors' Academy meeting minutes, December 1923; Graphical Interpretation of County Agent Work, 1919-1922; the "Y" Hut; Debate schedule, 1926; and the lease between Louise Marshall & husband and the Board of Regents for the Post Office in building on University Ave., 1923.

scopecontent.p: Folders 1-7 Include letters from: Hamlin Garland regarding lectures, January 19, 1928; Neil Judd regarding proposed State Museum building on campus, May 18, 1928; Gene Tunney in reply to his HLS's offer of a position in the P.E. Department, January 4, 1934; and various individuals in reply to HLS's applications for a position somewhere in the scientific world, April 1935.
